title: Israel-Hamas war: The faces of the massacre in Gaza
summary: The Israeli offensive in the Gaza Strip, designed to punish Hamas for its October 7 attack, has claimed almost 28,000 lives in four months, 70% of them women and children. Le Monde tells the stories of nine of these victims, aged between 3 and 70.

title: How far can Marine Le Pen's deputy, Jordan Bardella, go?
summary: The 28-year-old chair of the far-right Rassemblement National party has become a household name in French politics. He is more popular than his mentor Marine Le Pen, and some wonder: Would he dare turn against her?

title: French men are increasingly turning to vasectomy
summary: The number of men opting for this form of contraception has risen from 1,940 in 2010 to 30,288 in 2022, thus overtaking female sterilizations, according to a study.

title: Jordan king urges 'lasting' Gaza ceasefire in talks with Biden
summary: The US has consistently refused to call for a full ceasefire, saying that it backs Israel's drive to defeat Hamas, and calling for shorter pauses with hostage deals instead.

title: The anger and grief of the survivors of London's Grenfell Tower disaster
summary: Nearly seven years after the fire that claimed 72 lives, victims and relatives of the deceased got to tell their stories to those they hold responsible for the tragedy.

title: Five surprising creations spotted at Maison & Objet
summary: A stool made from banknotes and furniture carved from olive wood are among the curiosities at the Paris show that are shaking up the world of design.

title: France suspends subsidized electric car program after surge
summary: The French government said it was suspending the plan to lease electric cars from €100 a month after subsidizing more than double the number of vehicles planned for 2024.

title: France moves to end birthright citizenship in overseas Mayotte
summary: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin promised a constitutional reform to make an exception to birthright citizenship in the Indian Ocean territory. The population has been protesting against a wave of illegal immigration.

title: France uncovers vast network of Russian disinformation sites
summary: One hundred and ninety-three fake news websites targeting both Ukraine and European countries, including France, Germany and Poland, have been identified. However, their audience seems limited.

title: Court orders Netherlands to stop delivery of F-35 parts to Israel
summary: The US-owned fighter jets parts are stored at a warehouse in the Netherlands and then shipped to several partners, including Israel.

title: What kind of work will be desirable in 2050?
summary: While it's easier to see what new technologies will destroy rather than what they will create, researchers are still trying to anticipate what work will be like in the future, writes Le Monde columnist Anne Rodier.

title: How 6-year-old Hind Rajab was killed as Palestinian Red Crescent tried to rescue her
summary: The child's cry for help had been widely broadcast as she was trapped under Israeli fire. The Red Crescent accused Israel of 'deliberately' targeting the ambulance sent to rescue her.

title: Finland elects pro-NATO Alexander Stubb as president
summary: Both a Europhile and NATO fan, the 55-year-old former prime minister and foreign minister is in favor of a 'more European' NATO.

title: Trump alarms allies by questioning NATO's solidarity
summary: The former American president said he was ready to 'encourage' Russian authorities 'to do whatever the hell they want' to any NATO country that did not contribute enough to the alliance's budget.

title: Rwanda plan incompatible with UK's rights obligations, British lawmakers warn
summary: The British Parliament's Joint Committee on Human Rights said in a new report that it had various concerns regarding the so-called Safety of Rwanda Bill.

title: The 'SAHG,' the girlfriend who patiently waits for her man to come home
summary: Anne Chirol reports on the digital archetypes of our time, from the #tradwife to the #fuckboy. This week, she focuses on the 'Stay at Home Girlfriend,' that homebody who doesn't work and is both emotionally and financially dependent.

title: Ukraine calls for Poland to 'punish' grain-spilling farmers as probe opened
summary: Polish farmers forcibly pried open Ukrainian trucks crossing into the European Union amid protests against what they see as cheap imports.

title: Tucker Carlson's Canadian stopover before his Moscow 'coup'
summary: The former Fox News star made a detour to Calgary, in the very conservative state of Alberta, in his role as influencer of a globalized far right.

title: Gunfire at New York City subway station kills 1, injures 5
summary: The New York Police Department says a teen dispute sparked the shooting.

title: Trump asks Supreme Court to stay ruling rejecting his call for immunity for alleged crimes during presidency
summary: Mr. Trump is the first major presidential candidate in US history to be seeking reelection under a cloud of multiple civil, criminal and legal investigations and trials.

title: Senegalese president says organized forces are threatening the country
summary: Mediators are working behind the scenes to avoid a wider conflict while a new demonstration is scheduled for Tuesday.

title: Brazil threatened by an unprecedented dengue epidemic
summary: The country is experiencing an explosion in the number of cases, particularly in Brasilia, where the incidence is 1,700 cases of dengue per 100,000 inhabitants. Hospitals are struggling to cope.

title: A Miss Japan of Ukrainian origin rekindles the debate on Japanese identity
summary: The victory of the first woman of foreign origin in the contest has sparked controversy, followed by scandal, in Japan.

title: Paris' AI scene is booming
summary: A series of French artificial intelligence start-ups are dreaming of carving out a place for themselves alongside the American giants, from which their founders often originate.

title: Europe to create military corridor to the East
summary: In response to the Russian threat, the European Union has earmarked €1.7 billion to reinforce the military transport infrastructure needed to move troops and materiel.

title: How ants detect and treat infections in their fellow creatures
summary: After raids against termites, 'Megaponera analis' ants sort out their infected brethren and treat them with antibiotics.

title: Amr Gamal spearheads southern Yemen's cinema and theater revival
summary: The self-taught filmmaker and director films to preserve the memory of his war-torn city, Aden.

title: Super Bowl is most-watched television show ever with 123.4 million viewers
summary: The record viewing figures for Sunday's game  included viewers across all platforms and was up 7% from last year’s 115.1 million average viewers, which was also the previous record.

title: The United States plays a crucial role in Europe's defense
summary: Former president Donald Trump's suggestion of an American withdrawal from NATO is worrying Europe, which does not have the resources, logistics or equipment to ensure its own security.

title: In the Netherlands, US and UK, military aid to Israel is challenged in the courts
summary: A Dutch court ordered the government on Monday to halt the export of F-35 parts to Israel, citing a clear risk of violations of international law.

title: Armenia says 4 killed in border flare-up with Azerbaijan
summary: The hostilities come shortly after Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev was reelected for a fifth term.

title: Handing out sunglasses in the Himalayas to protect against the damaging sun
summary: In Pakistan's Naltar Valley, the sun's rays are so intense that eight out of 10 people suffer from eye problems. German photographer Cornelius Kaess followed the work of Shades of Love, an NGO that gives sunglasses to these high-altitude inhabitants.

title: NATO: Trump electroshock should be a warning for Europe
summary: For too long, Europeans have deluded themselves about their security. They must now act and face the destructive Putin-Trump dynamic together.

title: A general feeling of vulnerability and decline is growing in France
summary: Lasting inflation and crises have led to a feeling of wear and tear which is worse in France than in other European countries, according to a recent study.

title: After Godrèche's sexual abuse accusations, release of new films by Doillon and Jacquot disrupted
summary: Distribution of the directors' forthcoming feature films is in jeopardy after the actress lodged rape complaints against them.

title: Russia declares Estonian PM Kaja Kallas 'wanted'
summary: The reason for listing Kallas as 'wanted under the Criminal Code' was not immediately clear.

title: After Trump's statements on NATO, France, Germany and Poland try to close ranks
summary: The three countries want to relaunch their cooperation within the framework of the Weimar Triangle but remain divided over the issue of 'strategic autonomy.'

title: Estonia, a small country ready for war against Russia
summary: This small Baltic country of 1.3 million inhabitants, which regained its independence in 1991, has never stopped regarding Moscow as an 'existential threat.'

title: Not your grandma's mink coat: Fur sheds its baggage in the hopes of a makeover
summary: Buoyed by the 'mob wife' trend for ostentatious luxury, real fur is making a quiet comeback. Craftsmen are working to bring out the best in old mink and sable pieces or to work with skins from the food industry.

title: Yasmine Belkaid, an immunity explorer, becomes head of the Institut Pasteur
summary: The French-Algerian immunologist took up her post as president of France's flagship biomedical research institution in January. Her ambition is to give it the financial means to stay at the top, while making its culture 'more agile, more open, more inclusive.'
